metadata.title: CVE-2020-26962 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Cross-origin iframes that contained a login form could have been recognizedby the login autofill service, and populated. This could have been used inclickjacking attacks, as well as be read across partitions in dynamic firstparty isolation. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3').
